summary.para: Returns S_OK if the operation associated with the current instance of this interface should continue.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the calling application should continue, S_FALSE if not.

remarks.para: In typical usage, a pointer to an interface is passed to a method of another object. That object, in turn, runs this method periodically to determine whether to continue its actions. For example, if a user clicks a cancel button, this method will start returning S_FALSE.

summary.para: Exposes a method that provides a simple, standard mechanism for objects to query a client for permission to continue an operation. Clients of , for example, must pass an implementation of IQueryContinue to the method.
